{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Caries Tetralogy by Newburn is a model that describes the four main factors that contribute to the development of dental caries. These factors are: 1) a susceptible tooth surface, 2) a diet rich in fermentable carbohydrates (substrate), 3) specific bacteria, and 4) time. Therefore, the fourth factor in this model is time.", "answer_choice": "B. Time."}
